website_summaries.verdict: HUF proudly brings in Brad Cromer’s debut pro model, the eponymous Cromer. A flat-out minimalist skate silhouette, the Cromer is precisely and stylishly pared down to only what’s necessary for skating. It also exhibits nautical styling (echoing Sperry designs), which is accentuated by the rubberized sturdy toe cap.Perhaps the Cromer’s biggest feature, the rubber toe piece runs around the suede upper, extending the foxing tape. This improves durability a lot and helps the shoe retain its shape longer. Priced at $75 apiece, the Cromer proves to be a good deal to pass up.
pros: The HUF Cromer has mostly racked up five-star ratings from reviewers who have praised its sterling quality
Getting a pair is so budget-friendly that some shoppers say they couldn’t pass up on such a good deal
Its simple, classy, nautical-inspired silhouette has appealed to most customers
The majority of testers like how comfortable and chill the Cromers are when skating and hanging out afterward
Many skaters are impressed with how well the Cromer holds up with daily shredding
A lot of reviewers say that it breaks in completely and gets so flexible after just one session
This pair looks so versatile that one can go from the skate park to a dinner date later on them, according to a couple of user reviews
At least one skater has pointed out that the eyelets are set more to the top to prevent lace breakage
Quite a handful of shoppers share that the Cromers have become their favorite pair, adding that they’ve bested their Vans shoes
The Cromer delivers much boardfeel and long-lasting grip, according to some skaters
cons: The Cromer is not suitable for high-impact skating as it doesn’t have sufficient cushioning and padding, according to some reviewers
Several users remark that it lacks arch support and recommend replacing the insoles with thicker ones
Quite a handful of skaters observe that the shoe sits quite low on feet, which makes the ankles feel exposed and vulnerable
A few wearers say that the end part of the shoe digs at their Achilles heel
Some colors don’t appear the same in person as they do online, according to some shoppers

customer_reviews.title: Dope shoes.
customer_reviews.text: So you're watchin trendy s*** on ig and you figure that you should cop some toecaps to up your no-comply game. Good on you. This is why you should buy these Cromers: - the toecap is no joke, it makes your shoes last longer. - these have vulcanized board feel, and they're not too bad for jumping down s***. - You're supporting a core skate brand. - they break-in in one sesh, and then they are super flexible. Btw this isnt somekind of paid review, i bought em with my own cash. Get these shoes and get your hellride on.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene Brodsky

customer_reviews.title: Tanny, Olive color is YELLOW - otherwise good shoe
customer_reviews.text: Good shoe but color is not "tanny Olive". According to my son they are rather bright yellow. Probably more yellow than picture but "tanny Olive" is not a good descriptive color name. I would give it 4 stars if my son didn't hate yellow shoes... He's keeping them to skate in since he won't care what happens to them and yellow color won't matter much.
customer_reviews.author: Posie

customer_reviews.title: Just got these in the mail and honeslty the best pair of shoes i purchased in a while
customer_reviews.text: Just got these in the mail and honeslty the best pair of shoes i purchased in a while. Usually i buy vans but these i can tell are gonna last you may need to wear them for a couple days to break them in but after that its a wrap you can go running in them haha great buy i can say.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: its a pretty good shoe with nice padding in the insoles for ...
customer_reviews.text: The end part of the shoe digs into my achilles heel, but otherwise, its a pretty good shoe with nice padding in the insoles for skater
customer_reviews.author: Skatingsgay

customer_reviews.title: Mehh
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are not ver comfortable, especially if you have flat/wide feet like I do. Lots of squeezing at the toe knuckles and loose around the arch. Not much arch/heel support, I'd recommend inserts. They do look great though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 5th pair!
customer_reviews.text: The HUF Cromer Pro model is a perfect shoe. Congrats Brad!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Too narrow and the cost to ship back and restocking charge would eliminate the refund.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Martin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: LOVE HUF SHOES - They are so comfortable and a fun run around shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta Benedict

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are incredibly narrow. If you have wide feet at all, these will be too tight.
customer_reviews.author: Timeless

customer_reviews.title: Better than Vans.
customer_reviews.text: Good support and fit. Feels much better than typical vans or comparable shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Probably my favorite pair of shoes ive had in a long while!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good luck trying to keep these bad boys clean. But that's the price of looking this nice.
customer_reviews.author: Sal D.

customer_reviews.title: like a Converse
customer_reviews.text: A little stiff, but I guess for a skater shoe, like a Converse.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Seems like it would skate well
customer_reviews.text: Seems like it would skate well, but they run pretty large and I can't skate well if my shoes aren't snug. I wear a size 9/9.5 US in vans and ordered a 9.5 in these shoes. They probably fit closer to a 10 or 10.5.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Palenik

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes insoles suck tho suggest getting better ones with more cushion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brad Cromer's Transworld Part
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoes; great for skating and also look nice as stuffing. Just don't wear without socks.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Matson

product_meta.title: HUF Men's Cromer Skate Shoe
product_meta.description: Brad Cromer’s debut signature vulcanized model. Straight-forward and to the point, much like Brad’s skating, the Cromer features everything you need in a great skate shoe and nothing more. The nautical inspired styling is accented by the distinct HUF CAP rubberized toe piece. The internal heel counter also features a strategically placed canvas binding that is designed to lock the heel in place. Branding and details were inspired by Brad’s affinity for 90’s noise bands and ‘shoegaze’ cover art.
feature_bullets: Lace-up sneaker featuring logo patch at tongue and rubberized protective cap at toe
